question: Which of the following is the correct statement about heterotrophs?
option1: They obtain their energy from sunlight, harnessed by pigments
option2: They obtain their energy by oxidizing organic molecules
option3: They make organic molecules from CO2
option4: They obtain their energy by consuming exclusively autotrophs
answer: They obtain their energy by oxidizing organic molecules
explanation: A heterotroph obtains its energy from organic molecules. An autotroph obtains energy from sunlight utilizing pigments including chlorophyll (A) and uses CO<sub>2</sub> and water to make organic molecules. heterotrophs can obtain their energy from ingesting autotrophs, but can also consume other heterotrophs.
